intro: Cardopatium boryi, commonly known as the Bory's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces a milky sap that is toxic to some animals and humans. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
